intro: Pedicularis plicata subsp. luteola, commonly known as the yellow hare's foot, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern Europe. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky areas. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
